channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tesla sells off after Elon Musk scraps his 2025 sales growth target and warns, ‘We could have a few rough quarters’
item.description: The Tesla CEO hosted an earnings call once more long on promises and short on specifics, especially regarding his month-old Robotaxi service that has ...

item.title: Oxford Economics says the crumbling housing market will continue deteriorating because of two key factors
item.description: Home prices are 55% higher than they were at the beginning of 2020.

item.title: Stanford dropout Sam Altman says college is ‘not working great’ for most people—and predicts major change in the next 18 years
item.description: The OpenAI CEO said his own kid probably won’t go to college.

item.title: Walmart–yes, Walmart–says AI agents are its future
